intro: Sedum alexanderi, commonly known as Alexander's stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it can withstand harsh weather conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
